sufian.video.server

Class RTSPRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • sufian.video.server.RTSPRequest

  • public class RTSPRequest
extends Object
    A class for parsing RTSP requests from the client.

    For details on RTSP requests, see RFC 2326 section 6.

    Author:
    Sufian Latif

    • Field Summary

      Fields

    • Field Detail

      • TAG

        private static final String TAG
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEBUG

        private static final boolean DEBUG
        Set this to true to get Log messages from this class.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • regexMethod

        private static final Pattern regexMethod
        RegEx for extracting the RTSP method from the request line. The method is declared in the first line of an RTSP request.

        Example:
        DESCRIBE rtsp://127.0.0.1:8554/ RTSP/1.0
        -------- ----------------------
         method       uri

        See details on RFC 2326 section 6.1.

        Also see the method specifications in RFC 2326 Section 10.

      • rexegHeader

        private static final Pattern rexegHeader
        RegEx for parsing request header fields. Each line after the request line contains a header field and corresponding value.

        Example:
        CSeq:     5
        -------- --------
         header   value

        See details on RFC 2326 section 6.2.

      • method

        String method
        RTSP method name, parsed from the request line.

      • uri

        String uri
        URI of the resource being requested.

      • headers

        HashMap<String,String> headers
        This HashMap keeps the header fields and their values as key-value pairs.

    • Method Detail

      • parseRequest

        public static RTSPRequest parseRequest(BufferedReader input)
                                throws IOException,
                                       IllegalStateException,
                                       SocketException
        Reads a request from client and parses the fields.
        Parameters:
        input - The BufferedReader to read the request from
        Returns:
        The parsed request.
        Throws:
        IOException - If this input is closed or some other I/O error occurs
        IllegalStateException - When the RegEx cannot find a match
        SocketException - When the Socket is closed
